00055 {

00057

00059         SelfDoc::Opt DataBlockRows = {"data-block-rows", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "320", "320", "NA", "NA", "Data block rows."};
00060         opts.push_back(DataBlockRows);
00061

00086 /**
00087  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00088  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00089  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00090  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00091  *
00092  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00093  *
00094  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00095  */
00096 SelfCreate* CNIntensityAdjustmentMethodHighPassFilter::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string>& params) 
00097 {
00098         SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00099         std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts = getDefaultDocOptions();
00100         CNIntensityAdjustmentMethodHighPassFilter* pMethod = new CNIntensityAdjustmentMethodHighPassFilter();
00101         std::string strPrefix = getPrefix();
00102 
00103         pMethod->data_block_rows = setupIntParameter("data-block-rows", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00104         pMethod->data_block_cols = setupIntParameter("data-block-cols", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00105         pMethod->mini_block_rows = setupIntParameter("mini-block-rows", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00106         pMethod->mini_block_cols = setupIntParameter("mini-block-cols", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00107         pMethod->global_smooth_weight = setupDoubleParameter("global-smooth-weight", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00108         pMethod->local_smooth_weight = setupDoubleParameter("local-smooth-weight", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00109         pMethod->converged = setupDoubleParameter("converged", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00110         pMethod->m_bUseSingleBlock = setupBoolParameter("use-single-block", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00111         
00112         return pMethod;
00113 }

00137 /**
00138  * @brief Run the calculations.
00139  */
00140 void CNIntensityAdjustmentMethodHighPassFilter::run()
00141 {
00142         Verbose::out(1, "CNIntensityAdjustmentMethodHighPassFilter::run(...) start");
00143 
00144         // TODO: Parameterize this.
00145         // This will currently be set up for both cyto2 full and cyto2 focused
00146         // arrays.  The algorithm was developed on cyto2 full arrays where the
00147         // copy number probes are laid out in 4 bands.  If the image is oriented
00148         // so that the logo is in the top left corner the bands are horizontal
00149         // spanning the entire image.  In order to save RAM the bands were
00150         // one at a time.  The function index_to_rc takes a probe ID along with
00151         // the width of the image to find the row and column orientation used
00152         // in this module.  This is a right-hand coordinate system.
00153 
00154 
00155 /*     This is a set of additional comments added when this module was extended to be used on the
00156  *     snp6 and snp7 chip.  The original use on the 2.7M chip only analyzed the CN probes.  These
00157  *     probes were located on a set of 4 bands across the chip. The extension to snp6 and snp7
00158  *     chips treats the whole chip as a single block and takes all SNP and CN probes into analysis. 
00159  *
00160  *     The original meaning of the data_block_rows  and data_block_column parameter values, set on 
00161  *     the command line input, were the number of rows and columns in the blocks of CN probes.  The  
00162  *     blocks themselves were then defined by hard coding the row value at which the block started.
00163  *
00164  *     In order to do a single block analysis these two parameter values are now interpreted as the
00165  *     number of rows and columns in the entire chip, and the above row value of the starting position
00166  *     of the block is given as 0.
00167  *
00168  *     In order to maintain backwards compatibility a new module option was defined. It is 
00169  *     "--use-single-block".  It is only used when single block analysis is desired on the 2.7M
00170  *     chip.  Without this option being defined on the command line input, multiple block analysis
00171  *     is performed on 2.7M, single block is performed on snp6/snp7 and 310K. 
00172  */
00173 
00174         vector<int> data_block_starts; 
00175         // We now determine what type of chip and whether or not we do single or multiple block analysis.
00176         // Chip is 310K.  Always do single block analysis. 
00177         if (data_block_rows == data_block_cols) // assume we are running the focused array.
00178         {
00179                 data_block_starts.push_back(0);  // first row of the image
00180         }
00181         if(m_pEngine->getOptBool("cyto2"))
00182         {
00183                 // Chip is 2.7M and we want multiple block analysis 
00184                 if(! m_bUseSingleBlock)
00185                 {
00186                         // The 4 cyto2 full bands are described by the start row and the height
00187                         // of the band.  Each band is called a data block.
00188 
00189                         data_block_starts.push_back(184);  // Top band / data block
00190                         data_block_starts.push_back(686);  // Second from top
00191                         data_block_starts.push_back(1196); // Second from bottom
00192                         data_block_starts.push_back(1694); // Bottom band
00193                 } 
00194                 // Chip is 2.7M and single block analysis requested on command line.
00195                 else
00196                 {
00197                     data_block_starts.push_back(0);  // Top band / data block
00198                 } 
00199         }
00200         // Chip is either snp6 or snp7. Single block analysis always performed.
00201         else
00202         {
00203                 data_block_starts.push_back(0);  // Top band / data block
00204         }
00205 
00206 
00207         int image_cols = data_block_cols;      // The width of the image.  Probably this 
00208                                                // will always be the same as data_block_cols.
00209 
00210         // To speed up the filtering the background (low frequency component) is
00211         // computed by small blocks rather than individual probe cells.  For 
00212         // example an 8x8 block will reduce the computations in the iterative
00213         // portion of the algorithm by 64.  The blocks need not be square or
00214         // a power of two or divide into a larger number evenly. Just not too
00215         // big for smoothness and not too small for speed.
00216 //      int mini_block_rows=8;
00217 //      int mini_block_cols=8;
00218 
00219         // The high pass filter depends on a local and global weight.  The
00220         // global weight enforces long term trends in the bakcground through
00221         // an imposed hierarchy in the data. The local weight enforces short
00222         // term trends by enforcing that the background be similar to the 
00223         // immediately surrounding region.   Implicit here is a wieght of 1.0
00224         // for the observed value.  The local and global weights of 8.0 and 8.0
00225         // are reasonable.  They can be doubled or halved without excessive
00226         // changes in the background.  These would make good default values.
00227         // They should never be less than 0.0.  Large values, say greater
00228         // than 32.0 are may not be harmful but not particularly useful and
00229         // could cause convergence to slow.  As far as I am concerned, these
00230         // values could be hard coded in by assigning them to a macro.
00231 //      double local_smooth_weight = 8.0;
00232 //      double global_smooth_weight = 8.0;
00233 
00234         // A reasonable value.  Can make it 0.001 if wanted.  Convergence is
00235         // fast.  I doubt that the extra iteration or two to get to 0.001
00236         // would be noticed.
00237 //      double converged = 0.01;
00238 
00239 //      For the Cyto2 array. The entire image is treated as a single block
00240 //      and would look like what is below.
00241 /*
00242         if (m_pEngine->getOptInt("array-size") == 658) // CytogeneticsFocused_Arrayy
00243         {
00244                 data_block_starts.clear();
00245                 data_block_starts.push_back(0);  // first row of the image
00246                 data_block_rows = 658;       // height of the image
00247                 data_block_cols = 658;       // width of the image
00248 
00249                 image_cols = 658;            // width of the image
00250         }
00251 */
00252         // Do the bands / data blocks one at a time
00253         for (int iblock=0; iblock<data_block_starts.size(); iblock++) {
00254                 // start and stop of the band
00255                 int row_start = data_block_starts[iblock];
00256                 int row_stop = row_start + data_block_rows;
00257 
00258                 // For speed we need a fast lookup table to map probe ids to
00259                 // their position in the input probe id vector vProbeIDs.
00260                 // .first=id .second=position
00261                 vector<pair<int,int> > lookup;
00262                 pid_lookup(lookup,row_start,row_stop,image_cols);
00263 
00264                 // Make an instance of the smoother.  Resizing or clearing is not
00265                 // implemented so make sure it gets deleted after each use.
00266                 DataBlock * DB = new DataBlock(data_block_rows, data_block_cols,
00267                                 mini_block_rows, mini_block_cols);
00268 
00269                 // Load up the DataBlock with whatever was observed.  Missing
00270                 // values are okay.  If not entered the entry is missing.  The
00271                 // indexing using the lookup table is not user friendly but
00272                 // it is fast and otherwise would be slow.
00273                 for (int i=0; i<data_block_rows; i++) {
00274                         for (int j=0; j<data_block_cols; j++) {
00275                                 int idx = i*image_cols + j;
00276                                 if (lookup[idx].first) {
00277                                         float fIntensity = getProbes()->at(lookup[idx].second)->getIntensity();
00278                                         float fMedianIntensity = getProbes()->at(lookup[idx].second)->getMedianIntensity();
00279                                         DB->set_value(i,j, log2(fIntensity/fMedianIntensity));
00280                                         }
00281                                 }
00282                         }
00283 
00284                 // Once the data has been entered load the full hierarchy of
00285                 // the data block.
00286                 DB->load_array_level();
00287 
00288                 //  Run the smoother to convergence.  The DataBlock knows what to do.
00289                 DB->mrf_smooth(local_smooth_weight, global_smooth_weight, converged);
00290                 if (iblock == 0) {CNAnalysisMethod::memory("HighPassFilter::run(...)");}
00291 
00292                 // Pull the background estimate out of the DataBlock.
00293                 for (int i=0; i<data_block_rows; i++) {
00294                         for (int j=0; j<data_block_cols; j++) {
00295                                 int idx = i*image_cols + j;
00296                                 if (lookup[idx].first) {
00297                                         CNProbe* p = getProbes()->at(lookup[idx].second);
00298                                         float fIntensity = log2(p->getIntensity());
00299                                         fIntensity -= DB->background(i,j);
00300                                         float fTwo= 2.0;
00301                                         p->setIntensity(pow(fTwo,fIntensity));
00302                                 }
00303                         }
00304 
00305                 }
00306                 delete DB;
00307                 
00308         }
00309         if (m_pEngine->getOptBool("keep-intermediate-data"))
00310         {
00311                 writeIntensities("highpass-filter");
00312         }
00313         Verbose::out(1, "CNIntensityAdjustmentMethodHighPassFilter::run(...) end");
00314 }
00315 
00316 
00317 void CNIntensityAdjustmentMethodHighPassFilter::pid_lookup(vector<pair<int,int> > & lookup, const int row_start,
00318                 const int row_stop, const int image_width)
00319 {
00320         int block_sz = (row_stop - row_start)*image_width;
00321         lookup.resize(block_sz,make_pair<int,int>(0,0));
00322 
00323         for (int i=0; i<getProbes()->size(); i++) {
00324                 pair<int,int> row_col = index_to_rc(getProbes()->at(i)->getProbeID(),image_width);
00325                 if (row_col.first >= row_start && row_col.first < row_stop) {
00326                         int row = row_col.first - row_start;
00327                         int array_index = row*image_width + row_col.second;
00328                         lookup[array_index].first = getProbes()->at(i)->getProbeID();
00329                         lookup[array_index].second = i;
00330                 }
00331         }
00332 }
